timeline.message:
Bump tektoncd/pipeline to v0.12.1

This will bump tektoncd/pipeline to v0.12.1 for both
v1alpha and v1beta1 resource.
Also use the respective dep as in the main project

Bump tektoncd/pipeline to v0.12.1

This will bump tektoncd/pipeline to v0.12.1 for both
v1alpha and v1beta1 resource.
Also use the respective dep as in the main project

timeline.bodyText:
The test suite is named V1alpha1PipelineCrudTest
Maybe we should create a V1beta1PipelineCrudTest suite with v1beta1 specific tests.
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: Ok, sorry, missed the first part of the import. I suppose something has changed in the base v1alpha1 api (but this change is weird for me nonetheless)
replies.author: manusa

replies.bodyText: that's caused by the update of the v1alpha1 dependency
replies.author: Fabian-K

timeline.bodyText: as mentioned, v1alpha1 should not be updated to the latest version!
timeline.author: Fabian-K

replies.bodyText: Yup I misunderstood it. I thought the v1beta1 client for only v1beta1 resources. I think it has both latest v1alpha1 and v1beta1. While v1alpha client is for old v1alpha1 resources only. In that case, we don't need to update v1alpha1 client then
replies.author: piyush-garg

timeline.bodyText: Do you know why this is necessary?
timeline.author: Fabian-K
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2,10 +2,17 @@ module github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/extensions/tekton/generator
 
 require (
 	github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/generator v0.0.0
-	github.com/tektoncd/pipeline v0.11.2
-	k8s.io/apimachinery v0.17.2
+	github.com/tektoncd/pipeline v0.12.1
+	k8s.io/api v0.17.3 // indirect
+	k8s.io/apimachinery v0.17.3
+	k8s.io/client-go v0.17.3 // indirect
 )
 
-replace github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/generator v0.0.0 => ./../../../generator
+replace (
+	github.com/fabric8io/kubernetes-client/generator v0.0.0 => ./../../../generator
+	k8s.io/api => k8s.io/api v0.16.5
+	k8s.io/apimachinery => k8s.io/apimachinery v0.16.5
+	k8s.io/client-go => k8s.io/client-go v0.16.5

replies.bodyText: I did this to match with whatever is used in upstream https://github.com/tektoncd/pipeline/blob/release-v0.12.x/go.mod#L63
replies.author: piyush-garg

timeline.bodyText: I´m not sure why there are changes in the go.sum for the v1alpha1. Anyway, they don´t seem to affect the resulting json. Therfore I´m fine with both options: reverting or keeping them
timeline.author: Fabian-K
